description: Ms. codex. Title from note on fol. 1a. 15 lines per page. Written in clear medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for overlining and reinking, and larger script for headings. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Ḥāshiyah on the margins of some fol. (see fol. 2b-3a; 74a-119b). Table of contents on fol. 2a-b. Biographical note on the author on fol. 3a. Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. 1a: "S raqm 65". Copy completed on 12 Shaʻbān 787 [Sept. 18, 1385] (colophon, fol. 289b). Incipit: الحمد لله خالق النسم ورازق القسم مبدع البدايع وشارع الشرايع ... قال الشيخ الامام ... على بن محمد البزدوى ... العلم نوعان علم التوحيد والصفات وعلم الشرايع والاحكام Explicit: وذلك مثل تناول محظور الاحرام عن ضروره لحقت بالمحرم انه ترخص له ويضمن الجزاء فكذا ههنا
author: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
extent: 290 leaves: paper ; 218 x 160 (131 x 82) mm. bound to 220 x 167 mm.
provenance: Two ownership statements on fol. 289b, signed Shaykh Ḥasan ibn JLB Darwīsh, and Muṣṭafá ibn Maḥmūd al-Qāḍī bi-madīnat Izmīr. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.

binding_note: The binding consists of two disparate covers bound by a brown leather spine. The upper cover is made of brown leather on paper pasteboard with a central blind stamped mandorla. The lower cover is made of brown leather over paper pasteboard with a central blind tooled medallion outlined in gold, the oulining developing into two pendants on the vertical axis, within an elaborate outer border. Paper pastedowns.
